fields.description: Sent to adapt when a tree or sighting is flagged
fields.subject: [AshTag Admin] An update or tree was flagged

fields.body:
Dear ADAPT,

Someone has just added a tag number to a tree:

    {{ url }}

You can reject this tag by selecting 'Reject this tag' in the admin list:

    {{ admin_url }}

The tree was {{ this_tree_was }}.

Have a good day!
fields.description: Sent to Adapt when a tree is tagged
fields.subject: [AshTag Admin] A tree was claimed

fields.body:
Hello,

The latest AshTag export data is attached to this email. Please respect user privacy and data protection.

Best regards,

The AshTag Team
fields.description: Email sent internally with exported data
fields.subject: Latest AshTag export (internal use)

fields.body:
Hello,

The latest AshTag export data is attached to this email. Please respect user privacy and data protection.

Best regards,

The AshTag Team
fields.description: Email sent to the Sylva foundation with exported data
fields.subject: Latest AshTag export for Sylva Foundation

fields.body:
{{ user.first_name }},

An update was posted to your Tagged Tree.

You can see the update here:

    {{ url }}

Please note, if the update is not for your tree, you can flag the update and it
will be removed.

Have a good day!
fields.description: The email sent to a tree's creator upon another user submitting a sighting
fields.subject: Your tree has been updated

fields.body:
Hello,

Thank you for submitting your tree on AshTag.org.

Perhaps take the time to buy a tagging pack, allowing others to help track the progress of your tree:

{{ buy_tags_url }}

Adam
fields.description: Sent to a user when they submit a sighting for an untagged (and therefore new) tree.
fields.subject: Thank you for the sighting!
Your order has been shipped
